timeline.bodyText: Since sharedPreferences are sync, you could try to create an actual task here to get concurrency.
timeline.author: rlazo

timeline.bodyText: Since you're reading all the keys at once and not dealing with the sharedpreferences anymore, it may not be necessary to sync the whole method.
timeline.author: rlazo

replies.bodyText: The second part (added todo) will need to coordinate with android download manager, so I'll need the sync when I add that.
replies.author: annzimmer

timeline.message: Update to background thread execution for listDownloadModels call.

timeline.bodyText: the is prefix in the name suggests a boolean response. What about using maybe, like maybeGetUpdatedModel? It's a bit more verbose.
timeline.author: rlazo
rlazo

timeline.bodyText:
You could use a singleThread executor like in

  
    
      firebase-android-sdk/firebase-messaging/src/test/java/com/google/firebase/messaging/ImageDownloadRoboTest.java
    
    
         Line 53
      in
      fe51be9
    
    
    
    

        
          
           executor = Executors.newSingleThreadExecutor(); 
        
    
  


That way the test shouldn't finish before running the tasks.
timeline.author: rlazo

timeline.message: Update to background thread execution for listDownloadModels call.

timeline.bodyText: AFAIK this is no longer needed when using the single thread executor.
timeline.author: rlazo

timeline.bodyText: You can probably get rid of this too.
timeline.author: rlazo

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if Tasks.await(task) could be used instead here?
timeline.author: vkryachko

replies.bodyText: I had tried that got - "java.lang.IllegalStateException: Must not be called on the main application thread", found this solution was used elsewhere.
replies.author: annzimmer

timeline.message: update executor usages in unit tests.
